Bash(git -C "c:/Users/sohae/o4o-platform" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(asset-copy-core\): extract platform core package — WO-O4O-ASSET-COPY-CORE-EXTRACTION-V1

Extract asset copy logic into @o4o/asset-copy-core with:
- PermissionChecker interface + DefaultPermissionChecker \(injectable role check\)
- BaseResolver abstract class for service-specific content resolution
- AssetCopyService with PermissionChecker injection
- Controller Factory using service.checkPermission\(\)
- Add asset-copy-core to deploy-api.yml CI/CD pipeline
- Fix migration 20260216200002 unique constraint handling \(ON CONFLICT\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "c:/Users/sohae/o4o-platform" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
test\(asset-copy-core\): hardening tests — WO-O4O-ASSET-COPY-CORE-TEST-HARDENING-V1

61 tests across 5 tracks:
- Track A: Permission edge cases \(intersection, empty, undefined\)
- Track B: Resolver injection \(call verification, replacement\)
- Track C: Service logic \(copy flow, duplicates, validation\)
- Track D: Controller factory \(config injection, auth, response structure\)
- Track E: Cross-service isolation \(KPA/Neture/Cosmetics boundary\)

Coverage: Stmts 100%, Branch 91%, Funcs 100%, Lines 100%

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

WO-K-COSMETICS-ADMIN-AREA-V1:

EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\sohae\\o4o-platform" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix\(kpa\): isolate KPA-b demo roles from platform guards and common components

WO-KPA-B-ISOLATION-ALIGNMENT-V1: Remove demo-only roles \(kpa:district_admin,
kpa:branch_admin, kpa:branch_operator\) from all shared Guards and common UI
components. Replace with KPA-c production roles \(kpa-c:branch_admin,
kpa-c:operator\). KPA-b demo routes remain functional but no longer pollute
the platform permission structure.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\sohae\\o4o-platform" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''

causing TS2307 module resolution failures during deployment.

EOF
\)")
